reviews.review_msg: Really nice guy and good prof.

Kinney is a fair, kind and knowledgeable Professor but is unfortunately susceptible to going off topic in his lectures. After the midterm, his tangents got so bad that we didn't have one proper lecture. He is willing to review grades though and is a pretty easy marker. Easy A, Readings not required, attendance is required, and assignments easy.

Bryan is a good prof. He has a good sense of humour and makes the course interesting. However, he goes off topic quite a bit and is unclear with expectations on midterms, assignments and exams. Overall, good course with a good prof.

Probably one of the most interesting classes I have taken at SFU thus far. Kinney, is an amazing prof, humour can be dry at times but other than that he is awesome. Talks about how the enviro. has an impact on crime.  The final paper is a Literature Review, very difficult but rewarding.

i was going to drop this class but bryan made the material somewhat interesting so i kept it. i'm so glad i did cuz it's not difficult if you read the info. bryan knows the stuff well & he's a pretty lenient marker. also, he made jokes to keep students' attn in the seminar.

Bryan is a wicked prof. He really knows his material and makes lectures interesting by cracking jokes. If you like his humour, you'll enjoy his class. Exams are really fair and you'll have no problem getting an A if you do the readings and study a bit. Go Bryan
